description: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 2, 4} mod 7.
comments: a(n) is the set of values for m such that 7i+m is a perfect square.(The quadratic residues of 7 including the trivial case of k*7) [From _Gary Detlefs_, Mar 07 2010]The product of any two terms belongs to the sequence and therefore also a(n)^2, a(n)^3, a(n)^4 etc. - _Bruno Berselli_, Dec 03 2012
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,0,1,-1).
maple: for i from 1 to 56 do if(i mod 4=0) then print(floor(7*i-3)/4)+1) else print(floor(7*i-3)/4)) fi od; [From _Gary Detlefs_, Mar 07 2010]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
